incidents.title: Workers not connected; Andy developer cannot restart workers; push task blocked

summary.symptom: Workers are not connected and I don't have access to restart them. To restart the push task: start worker containers manually via deployment system, then I will dispatch push task. Alternative: push branches manually from local environment.
summary.impact: Workers recovered, but push workflow remains blocked until push dispatches are re-sent with valid contract-compliant payloads.
summary.next_action: Re-dispatch push tasks for jarvis-worker-1 and jarvis-worker-2 using branch names that match jarvis-<feature> and verify completion contract fields (especially commit_sha format).

notes.author: andy-developer
notes.text: Workers are not connected and I don't have access to restart them. To restart the push task: start worker containers manually via deployment system, then I will dispatch push task. Alternative: push branches manually from local environment.

notes.author: operator
notes.text: 2026-02-27: probe --skip-lint passed on jarvis-worker-1 and jarvis-worker-2 (review_requested); status now shows recent PASS runs. Remaining blockers are historical dispatch validation errors (branch must match jarvis-<feature>) and prior contract failures.

notes.author: operator
notes.text: 2026-02-27 fix applied: scripts/jarvis-worker-probe.sh now uses mktemp template without suffix; scripts/jarvis-dispatch-lint.sh now only cleans up temp stdin payloads and uses mktemp without suffix. Verification: jarvis-ops probe passed (2/2) without --skip-lint, followed by status showing new review_requested probe runs on both lanes.
